name: Auba Game
description:
This is 'Auba Game', a new video game from Outhouse Media.
The game depicts the inevitable end of the world, but instead of ending, it leads to many different endings, with plenty of hidden messages. The founder of the game is said to be obsessed with different aspects of the world, which include governments, religions and religion in general. He said: "I would like to share this idea of a New Amnesia world, where the world itself goes mad with madness. "This is not a game for all of us, but I am trying to let people experience what I think of as a New Amnesia world, one full of horror and disgust, created by people who are mad." He said all he wanted to do was let people "experience the madness and reveal what this world is, how it works and how it uses us, even if they are deeply religious." He added: "The game is to be played in the order of the time of the book in which it is written, which is revealed in the game itself." There is no word on whether he is also the creator of the short films 'What a Tale' and 'American Awakening' as some have speculated — but it appears that he is, at least, a big fan of tech (think the Oculus Rift, which he made with his father). But, if you're curious, we've got the 12-minute video to thank for at the top of the page, with a full description
